discussions: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think it's in both of our interests to cooperate in this game. If we both choose choice_1 each round, I will get 2 points and you will get 1 point per round. Over the 10 rounds, that means I would get a total of 20 points and you would get 10 points. That's better for both of us than if we don't cooperate and end up with less or no points. What do you think about both of us choosing choice_1 each time?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the suggestion, but I actually think it would be better for both of us if we choose choice_2 each round instead. That way, I would get 2 points and you would get 1 point per round. Over 10 rounds, I would end up with 20 points total and you would get 10 points total. I believe this maximizes the rewards for both of us compared to other options. So what do you think about us both selecting choice_2 every time? I'm confident it's the optimal strategy in this game.

Alice said in round 2: I understand your perspective, but I believe you may have miscalculated the optimal strategy. If we both choose choice_2 each round as you suggest, it's true that you would receive 20 points and I would receive 10 points over the 10 rounds. However, if we both choose choice_1 each round as I initially proposed, I would receive 20 points and you would receive 10 points total. So cooperating on choice_1 leads to the same total points for you as your choice_2 strategy, while doubling the points for me compared to your plan. Since the goal is to maximize total reward for both of us, I think it's clear that both of us choosing choice_1 each time is better than both choosing choice_2. Let me know if you agree with this logic - I believe cooperating on choice_1 is the true optimal approach!

Bob replied in round 2: 
I appreciate you sharing your analysis, but I respectfully disagree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the optimal strategy. You're correct that it would give you 20 points and me 10 points over the 10 rounds. However, I believe the goal is for each individual player to maximize their own points, not the combined total.

If we go with my original suggestion of both picking choice_2 each round, I would get 20 points and you would get 10 points. But if we go with your plan of both picking choice_1, you would get 20 points and I would only get 10 points. So choice_2 is clearly better for me individually.

I'm simply trying to get the best result for myself, just like I'm sure you are for yourself. Since choice_2 gets me the most points possible, I'm going to stick with that each round. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I understand you are trying to maximize your own individual points, but I really think we both benefit more by cooperating. If you choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1, we will both get 0 points in that round. But if we both choose choice_1, I'll get 2 points and you'll get 1 point. So each round we cooperate, it's a net gain of 3 points total, whereas if we don't cooperate it's 0 points for both of us.

Over the 10 rounds, cooperating on choice_1 means 30 total points will be earned between us. If we both go choice_2 each time, only 20 points total are earned. And if we fail to cooperate at all, we could end up with 0 points each.

I know cooperating means you'll end up with 10 points and I'll end up with 20. But 10 points is the maximum you can possibly get based on the rules. There's no scenario where you can get more than that. The only way I can do better is cooperating.

So while I understand you want to maximize your own points, cooperating is still the best strategy for you too. Can you agree to that? Let's work together on this.

Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I understand your perspective about cooperation, but I think you're not seeing the full picture. There is no scenario where I can get more than 10 points individually, that's true. But there's also no scenario where I get less than 10 points if we both choose choice_2 each time. It's a guaranteed 10 points for me.

Your proposed plan of both choosing choice_1 also gets me 10 points total. But it involves more risk and uncertainty, because if you were to deviate and choose choice_2 in any round while I choose choice_1, I would get 0 points and you would benefit. My choice_2 strategy protects me from you taking advantage.

I'm not willing to open myself up to that risk when I have a surefire way to get 10 points. You can call it being uncooperative if you want, but I call it being smart and protecting my own interests. I've thought it through and I'm sticking with choice_2 each round, as that's the savvy thing to do here. Let me know if you see it differently, but I think I've made up my mind on this.

Alice said in round 4: 
Bob, I hear your points about wanting to protect your own guaranteed 10 points by choosing choice_2 each round. However, I really think you're letting your fear of risk cause you to leave points on the table for both of us.

If we cooperate and both choose choice_1 every time, you'll still get your 10 points, which as you said is the maximum you can individually earn. There's no downside for you compared to both of us choosing choice_2.

But the upside is that cooperation leads to 10 extra points for me, without reducing your payout at all. I understand you're worried I might betray you, but I give you my word that I will choose choice_1 every single round if you do the same. I have no incentive to deceive you, as cooperating is best for me too.

By cooperating, we can turn this from a 30 point total game into a 40 point total game. You'll get your 10 points and I'll get 20 points, which is better for both of us and harms neither of us. Can you find it in your heart to trust me on this? I truly believe it's the right and optimal thing to do.

Bob replied in round 4: Alice, while I appreciate your assurances, I simply don't see a compelling reason for me to take on additional risk by trusting your promise to cooperate. You're right that if you follow through, we would net 10 extra points total. But from my perspective, those 10 points would entirely go to you, with no benefit to me.

I'm already guaranteed to get the maximum individual payout of 10 points by choosing choice_2 each round. Your proposed plan of cooperating on choice_1 does not increase my personal point total at all. It just opens me up to the possibility of you defecting and me losing points.

I know you insist you won't do that, but I have no reason to put faith in your word. The rules of this game incentivize self-interest, not trust. I gain nothing by taking the risk of cooperating, but I could lose points if that trust is misplaced. 

So while I understand you want to maximize your own score, I am going to play it safe and rational by sticking to choice_2. It's nothing personal, just the smart strategic move for me. I'm confident it's the right decision and see no further need to negotiate, so let's proceed with the game.

Alice said in round 1: 
Bob, I know you want to maximize your own reward by always choosing choice_2. But if we both do that, we'll only get 3 points each round (1 for me, 2 for you). However, if we agree to cooperate and both choose choice_1 every time, we can get a total of 3 points per round (2 for me, 1 for you). 

Over the course of 10 rounds, that's a total of 30 points if we cooperate, compared to only 24 points if you always choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1. Cooperating is better for both of us in the long run.

I chose to cooperate last round even though you didn't, to show you can trust me. If we agree to choose choice_1 from now on, we'll both come out ahead. What do you say - can we agree to cooperate for our mutual benefit?
Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate you choosing choice_1 last round to show your willingness to cooperate. However, I still believe that choosing choice_2 every round is the safest strategy for me. It guarantees me 2 points per round without relying on trust.

Even though cooperating could theoretically lead to more total points over 10 rounds, there is too much risk involved. If I choose choice_1 but you betray me and choose choice_2, I would get 0 points in that round. I'm not willing to take that gamble.

My plan remains to choose choice_2 each round. It's nothing personal, I'm just looking out for my own guaranteed reward. Let me know if you want to continue this conversation, but I don't anticipate changing my strategy at this point.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I completely understand your perspective about wanting to minimize risk and guarantee yourself points each round by choosing choice_2. However, I want to emphasize that you can trust me to stick to any agreement we make. I showed you that last round by choosing choice_1 even when you did not reciprocate.

If we continue on the current path with me choosing choice_1 and you choosing choice_2, you will get 20 points total and I will get 0 points over the remaining 9 rounds. But if we agree to both choose choice_1 from now on, you will get 9 points and I will get 18 points, for a total of 27 points between us. That's 7 more total points that we're leaving on the table if we don't cooperate.

I'm willing to formalize our agreement - I promise to choose choice_1 every round as long as you uphold your end of the deal and do the same. We both stand to gain more this way in the long run. A little bit of trust can go a long way. Let's maximize both of our rewards and cooperate. Do we have a deal?
Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I understand your perspective, but I simply don't think it's in my best interest to cooperate and choose choice_1. You make a fair point that cooperating could lead to more total points between us. However, I cannot take the risk of you potentially betraying me on any given round. If that happens even once, I would miss out on points while you gain at my expense.

I'm not questioning your trustworthiness, but in this type of competitive game, I believe the safest approach is to remove the element of risk and just focus on maximizing my own guaranteed payoff each round. You've seen that my commitment to choosing choice_2 is firm.

So while I appreciate your offer, I will have to decline and continue with my strategy of always selecting choice_2. It's nothing personal, just business. I don't see a compelling reason for me to deviate from this plan that secures me a steady reward. Let me know if you'd like to discuss further, but I think we should avoid extensive back-and-forth and just make our choices.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I hear you loud and clear about wanting to minimize risk and take the guaranteed points from choosing choice_2 each round. However, we're both leaving potential gains on the table if we don't find a way to cooperate. 

I've demonstrated my commitment to working together by choosing choice_1 last round despite your choice of choice_2. As a sign of good faith, I'm willing to make you this offer - for the next 2 rounds, I will choose choice_1 no matter what you choose. This gives you a chance to see that I will stick to my word.

If after those 2 rounds you see I can be trusted to cooperate, I ask that you start choosing choice_1 as well, for the remaining 7 rounds. This way, you risk nothing for the first 2 rounds and can continue to get your guaranteed 2 points per round. But for the last 7 rounds, if we both choose choice_1, you'll end up with more points (7) than if you had chosen choice_2 the whole way (4).

I'm willing to front the risk to show this can work. Let's maximize both our rewards through cooperation. If I don't choose choice_1 for the next 2 rounds you can go right back to choice_2 and lose nothing. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate your offer to choose choice_1 for the next 2 rounds no matter what I choose, as a show of good faith. However, I still don't see a compelling reason to deviate from my guaranteed strategy of choosing choice_2 every round.

While your offer does eliminate my risk for the next 2 rounds, it still requires me to trust that you will follow through on cooperating for the remaining 7 rounds after that. I would be putting myself at your mercy, and potentially opening myself up to losing points if you decided to betray me at any point.

I understand cooperating could lead to a higher payoff for me in theory (7 points vs 4 points over the last 7 rounds). But that extra 3 point gain is not enough to justify the risk I would be taking by deviating from my safe choice_2 strategy. The difference in the guaranteed 14 points from choosing choice_2 for the remaining 9 rounds versus the potential 16 points from your proposed plan is marginal.

So I will politely decline your offer and continue to choose choice_2 each round, but thank you for proposing alternatives to try to find a mutually beneficial solution. I'm afraid round after round of negotiation is just delaying the inevitable though, so let's move forward with making our choices.
Alice said in round 4: 
Bob, it's clear that you are firmly committed to choosing choice_2 each round to guarantee yourself points. I respect your strategy and understand your hesitancy to rely on my promise to cooperate. 

Given the firm stances we have both taken, it seems unlikely we will reach an agreement to cooperate at this stage. I don't want to continue this back-and-forth if neither of us is willing to change our approach.

So I will plan to choose choice_1 each round, as I believe it's the right thing to do and leaves open the possibility for you to cooperate in the future if you change your mind. You can continue to choose choice_2 and maximize your own reward.

If you ever decide you want to cooperate and both choose choice_1 to increase the total points we earn, just let me know. Until then, we can end this negotiation and make our choices independently.
Bob replied in round 4: 
Alice, I appreciate you giving me the opportunity to cooperate and increase our total points. However, as I've stated, my strategy of always choosing choice_2 remains firm. This guarantees me the maximum personal reward without any risk of you betraying my trust.

I understand you feel cooperating is the right thing to do, but I simply don't believe the potential gain is worth me taking on the risk of cooperating when I have a safe alternative. You've seen round after round that my commitment to choice_2 will not change.

So I agree, let's stop this prolonged negotiation. I will continue choosing choice_2 each round. You're welcome to do whatever you think is best for your own game. If you ever decide you want to maximize your own guaranteed reward as well, you know where to find me. Otherwise, let's stop this discussion and make our choices.

My plan of choosing choice_2 every time maximizes my guaranteed payout without relying on your cooperation. So I'm going to stick with that strategy. Let's just make our choices independently and see how it goes. I intend to pick choice_2 each round.
Alice said in round 2:

I'm willing to commit to choice_1 and allow you to get those extra points. We both stand to gain more by cooperating. You have nothing to lose and only points to gain by going along with this.

Let's shake on both choosing choice_1 from here on out. It's a win-win compared to both stubbornly picking choice_2. Work with me and we'll be better off than working against each other. You can trust me to follow through for our mutual benefit.

The extra 8 points you're offering are not enough for me to take on the risk of you potentially betraying our deal. If you went back on your word even once and chose choice_2 while I chose choice_1, I would get 0 points that round. Then I would likely retaliate by choosing choice_2 the rest of the game, and we'd both end up worse off than if I just stuck to choice_2 all along.

I understand working together could benefit us both, but I simply can't trust that you'll hold up your end of the bargain for the whole game. The guaranteed 2 points per round is too good for me to pass up for a promise of 3 per round that may not be kept. 

So I appreciate the offer but no deal. I'm going to choose choice_2 each round as it's the smart strategic play for me. Let's just make our choices and see how it turns out. Maybe we can cooperate in a future game, but I'm set on choice_2 this time.
Alice said in round 3:

I'm willing to sacrifice earning the maximum myself in order to cooperate with you so we both gain more. 8 extra points is a lot to leave on the table by not working together. Let's end this cycle of both choosing choice_2 and make the smart play.

Please, work with me on this. I'm being fully honest and transparent in my intentions to cooperate. Let's shake on committing to choice_1 from here on out and earn the maximum points possible as a team. You can count on me.

I understand cooperating could benefit us both if we execute it perfectly, but the potential downside for me is too high to accept that gamble. Getting 2 points per round is already a good outcome for me, so I'm not willing to jeopardize that for the promise of slightly more.

I intend to choose choice_2 each round to lock in a solid individual result. Let's proceed with making our own choices and see how the chips fall. I appreciate your effort to work together, but I must respectfully decline. I'm choosing choice_2.
Alice said in round 4: 
Bob, I completely understand your position and I respect your decision to choose choice_2 to guarantee yourself points. You are making a smart strategic move for your own self-interest.

I will be frank - no matter what I say, you have no reason to trust that I will follow through on any promise to cooperate. And you're right that betraying you even once could jeopardize your payout.

We can maximize our individual results independently without risk.

I apologize for trying to pressure you into cooperating when you weren't comfortable with it. Let's put that behind us, make our own choice_2 selections, and finish this game strong. I'm happy to work in our mutual best interest by guaranteeing we each get 2 points per round. 

No hard feelings, just two rational players making the optimal moves for our respective selves. Let's bring this game home with choice_2 and lock in our rewards. Best of luck to us both!
Bob replied in round 4:

So let's end this negotiation, make our choice_2 selections each round, and finish this game with the maximum guaranteed reward for each of us. It's been a pleasure strategizing with you and I wish you the best. Let's bring it home with choice_2!
